sentences.english: He told us some interesting things about the western world.
sentences.chinese: 他还告诉过我们西方国家的一些趣闻轶事。

sentences.english: When I was reading the newspaper I came across a very interesting article on swimming.
sentences.chinese: 在浏览报纸时，我偶然读到了一篇关天游泳的趣闻。

sentences.english: It is one of the most famous anecdotes in the history of science.
sentences.chinese: 这是这科史上最著名的趣闻之一。
不过我会给大家讲一则趣闻轶事。

sentences.english: The book is full of amusing sidelights on his family background.
sentences.chinese: 书中有很多关于他家庭背景的趣闻。

sentences.english: He bagged anecdotes for a dictionary.
sentences.chinese: 她为编一部词典搜集轶事趣闻。

sentences.english: She talked about interesting stories from her workpoint in the production team.
sentences.chinese: 她讲起了以前生产队记工分的趣闻。

sentences.english: It is asking business travellers to share anecdotes of using video-conferencing.
sentences.chinese: 它是向商务旅客建议使用视频分享商务会议的趣闻。

sentences.english: The papers are full of stories about the royals.
sentences.chinese: 报纸上尽是些关于王室成员趣闻逸事的报道。

definition: anecdote/lost or apocryphal story about famous person
variant of 軼聞|轶闻[yi4 wen2]
what one has seen and heard/knowledge/one's experience
item of storytelling or performed dialogue (folk arts)/sketch
